captions.text: We’re filming the music video for a song “Monster”
and the scale of this shooting is immense
so I think this music video will be a blockbuster.
This song is about a man’s heart;
a man who doesn’t want to be a Monster to her
even though other people swear at him
This video comprised with various scenes,
so this video can be explained with some tense scenes and backgrounds.
We look forward to having a lot of image changes to express “Monster”
so your great interests would be appreciated.

comments.text:
I understand this. These young people will go through hundreds, or 
thousands of "takes" and "cut" calls to please the people behind the 
camera. These people that dance and sing for you and me are put through 
hell. NOT an easy life to be popular when someone else is "Pulling the 
strings".
Simply put: The people you see before you singing and 
dancing....well,...their life is NOT their own. They cannot do what they 
want, when they want. They MUST look good for the camera. If they did not 
look good for the camera, they would not make $$$$$$$+.
Most of the $$$$$$+ does NOT go to the performer(s).
Just let any of them get old or sick....find out what happens next. ﻿

An exclusive clip of Big Bang’s new music video, ‘Monster”, was released on 
the official youtube channel on June 5th. 

The video reveled the development of the concept, filmography, and 
performances within Monster. Big Bang hinted to their viewers about the 
meaning behind ‘Monster’ as well as their thoughts and opinions on the 
video.

In other news, Big Bang released a special edition album on June 3rd called 
‘Stay Alive’ featuring songs titles Monster, Bingle Bingle, Still Alive, 
and the korean version of Feelings and Ego.
